results.title: Gabbeh
results.creator_credit: Mohsen Makhmalbaf, Khalil Mahmoudi, Khalil Daroudchi, MK2 Productions and Sanayeh Dasti
results.brief_description: With “Gabbeh” Mohsen Makhmalbaf creates a romantic parable of universal resonance. A gabbeh is an Iranian carpet produced by the nomadic Ghashghai tribe of southern Iran. This episodic tale is framed with exquisite interludes on the colours of nature, painting each scene with landscapes and vistas of breathtaking beauty.

results.title: Donnie Brasco
results.creator_credit: Mike Newell, Gail Mutrux, Louis Digiamo, Barry Levinson, Mark Johnson and Mandalay Entertainment
results.brief_description: This is a gangster movie quite like no other which is more concerned with character study, friendship and betrayal. Donnie Brasco (Johnny Depp), also known as Joe the Jeweller, befriends Mafia small man and former assassin Lefty Ruggiero (Al Pacino). Lefty sees in the young Donnie a chance to rise in the Mafia ranks, something the aging Lefty, with his drug addicted son and passive wife is no longer capable of. Unbeknown to Lefty, Donnie Brasco is an under cover special agent, working with the FBI to infiltrate the New York Mafia underworld. What at first seems a simple case of undercover work is complicated by Donnie’s genuine feelings of friendship towards Lefty and Lefty’s loyalty towards Donnie. Based on the book by Joseph D. Pistone with Richard Woodley. Also starring Michael Madsen, Bruno Kirby, James Russo and Anne Heche.

results.title: Wilde
results.creator_credit: Brian Gilbert, Peter Samuelson, Marc Samuelson, INDF International and Samuelson Entertainment
results.brief_description: In this world there are only two tragedies. One is not getting what one wants, and the other is getting it (Oscar Wilde). Stephen Fry stars as Oscar Wilde, one of the most controversial writers of our time. A man brimming with wit and honesty, but a life tragically plagued by scandal. This video traces the rise and fall of Oscar, including; his relationship with Lord Alfred Douglas, “Bosie” (Jude Law), and the loving relationships he had with his devoted wife, Constance (Jennifer Ehle) and two children, and his publicized trial and imprisonment. What emerges is a portrait of a man of incredible literary talent, fierce love and passion, loved by those of whom he gave his affection but ultimately denigrated by conservative society for his perceived amoral and hedonistic lifestyle.

results.title: Joey
results.creator_credit: Ian Barry, Michael Lake and Village Roadshow Pictures
results.brief_description: Kangaroos hold a special place in Billy’s (Jamie Croft) heart, he even trespasses to protect them from being hunted on neighbouring Queensland farms. His evil neighbour, Dixon (Errol O’Neill) hires a Kanga Catcher who drugs the kangaroos and transports them to the city, all but a lonely joey who Billy rescues. Together with the daughter of an American ambassador, boy, girl and joey begin a journey to reunite the young kangaroo with its kidnapped family. An adventure film that the whole family will enjoy. Cast also includes Alex McKenna, Rebecca Gibney, Ed Begley Jr and Ruth Cracknell.

results.title: No love for Johnnie
results.creator_credit: Ralph Thomas, Betty E. Box and General Film Distributors
results.brief_description: Johnnie Byrne (Peter Finch) is a man with the political ambition to ascend to number one in the Northern country industrial town in which he was raised. Although his party is successful and is voted into office, Johnnie is overlooked for selection. Returning home, dejected, he discovers his wife, Alice had secret political ideas of her own and has left Johnnie to pursue her own ambitions. He begins an affair with a photographers model, but this too, like his political career is absent of love. A strange turn of events sees Alice attempting to rekindle her relationship with Johnnie and his good fortune seems to continue as he is offered a position in cabinet. To Johnnies horror he discovers that the reason why he wasn’t offered the position before was because of Alice’s connections to the Communist Party and Johnnie must ultimately decide between love and his political ambition. Cast also includes Mary Peach, Stanley Holloway, Donald Pleasence and Billie Whitelaw.

results.title: Windom's way
results.creator_credit: Ronald Neame, John Bryan and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Dr Alec Windom (Peter Finch) is a resident doctor on the island of Selim in South East Asia. He is a committed and dedicated doctor to both his patients and the wider community which is currently experiencing unrest. It is into this environment that Windom’s estranged wife, Lee (Mary Ure) arrives. Because of his prominent and respected position in society, Windom attempts to act as mediator between the exploited natives and the Government to prevent a native uprising but is thwarted by betrayal from the authorities. Disillusioned by his inability to reconcile the situation and by the betrayal that occurs, Windom prepares to leave the country with his wife. Cast also includes Natasha Parry, Robert Flemying, Michael Horderna and Marne Maitland. Based on a novel by James Ramsay Ullman.

results.title: Who dares wins
results.creator_credit: Ian Sharp, Euan Lloyd and Sturia Leasing Ltd
results.brief_description: Judy Davis stars in a controversial role as the leader of an anti-nuclear terrorist group. They are planning to attack the American Embassy residence in London to draw attention to their cause. Lewis Collins, posing as a court martialled S.A.S. Captain joins the terrorists in their attack on the embassy and subsequent kidnapping. Once housed in the embassy, Collins commences a combined air and ground attack on the S.A.S. The lives of the hostages are at stake as the S.A.S begin their rescue operation. Also starring Edward Woodwood and based on an original story by George Markstein.

results.title: The 3 worlds of Gulliver
results.creator_credit: Jack Sher, Charles H. Schneer and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Adventurer Gulliver leaves home with dreams of drama on the high seas. Tragedy strikes however in the form of a storm, washing Gulliver to the shores of Lilliput; an island inhabited by people who are just a few inches high. Gulliver quickly wins their favour and is crowned hero when he is able to wipe the Lilliputians enemy fleet. After his experiences with the little people he travels to Brobdingnag; a country inhabited by giants. Gulliver is captured by the giants as a potential toy for the Queen of Brobdingnag. Special effects are courtesy of Ray Harryhausen. Starring Kerwin Mathews, Jo Morrow and June Thorburn.

results.title: The Dead zone
results.creator_credit: David Cronenberg, Debra Hill, Rastar Productions and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Faithfully adapted from the Stephen King novel of the same name, this is the chilling story of a man who wakes up from a five-year coma with the extraordinary power to see visions of the past, present and, most frightening, the future. A tense and thought provoking production in which Walken gives one of his most intense and believable performances.

results.title: The Stepfather
results.creator_credit: Joseph Ruben, Jay Benson and ITC Productions
results.brief_description: Terry O’Quinn is “the Stepfather”, the man with the generic name because he has been a stepfather many times. He also has a gruesome way of ending relationships and severing the family ties; he kills them when they fail to meet his perfect standards and moves on to the next family. Shelley Hack and Jill Schoelen are cast as his latest victims.
